channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sofa dumped by a tree, 8th September
item.description:
This spot is continually being used for fly tipping. Is there anything the council/ I can do such as put up a notice or camera etc? This happens probably once a week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-43, Shenley Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reported to Southwark Council that bins outside 20-26 Park Street SE1 9EQ were not emptied on Friday. They have still not been emptied and there are now mice in the bin area., 8th September
item.description:
There are mice because bins are used by the public and food waste from Borough Market. People eat take away food in Gatehouse Square and use residents bins.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-30, Park Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Litter in the street, 8th September
item.description:
The bin needs to be emptied more often. There is always litter in this street, from the corner to the train station.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This person did not pick up dog poo, 8th September
item.description:
At 6.40am as I was collecting my milk bottle, I watched a person allow his/her dog to poo and bot pick it up I shouted to the person “you’ll pick that up, yeah?” The person shouted back “yeah”, but then I watched and took pictures as this person walked away without doing so. i have one more photo that I couldn’t upload.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Basingdon Way, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox on the side of the road, 8th September
item.description:
There is a dead fox on the side of the road. It’s getting pretty squashed with cars driving over. I noticed it whilst out walking at 8.15 this morning (8th September).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Southborough, London

item.title: Graffiti on ancient tree, 8th September
item.description:
Some idiots have vandalised and damaged an ancient tree with graffiti of the St George's cross. This proves they don't love their country and care about protecting nature. They are marking their territory like criminal gangs and should be treated as such. They have also done it to a bin, and a leaf identifying sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Path, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
